bug.author: subhankar-ghosh
bug.description:
I am using Huber loss implementation in tf.keras in tensorflow 1.14.0 as follows: <denchmark-code>huber_keras_loss = tf.keras.losses.Huber( delta=delta, reduction=tf.keras.losses.Reduction.SUM, name='huber_loss' ) </denchmark-code>
I am getting the error AttributeError: module 'tensorflow.python.keras.api._v1.keras.losses' has no attribute 'Reduction' I have tried using tf.losses.Reduction, tf.compat.v2.losses.Reduction nothing seems to work. Did tensorflow remove Reduction from tf.keras.losses, it is strange if they did so because their documentation still shows: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.14/api_docs/python/tf/keras/losses/Huber#args>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r1.14/api_docs/python/tf/keras/losses/Huber#args</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/subhankar-ghosh>@subhankar-ghosh</denchmark-link> , Can you please retry this on the tf-nightly release, and post the full code to reproduce the problem? The 1.14 release was cut at the beginning of June, and it's entirely possible that this is fixed.
This seems fixed in TF 2.1. Please reopen if you are still hitting errors.
